intro: Tovomitopsis costaricana, commonly known as the Costa Rican bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories and along stream banks. Its leaves are broad and elliptical, often with a velvety texture, while its stems are erect and branching. Tovomitopsis costaricana plays a role in local ecosystems by providing nectar for pollinators and habitat for small organisms.
